title: 109_hr470
content: The Act titled "Improving Electronic Voting Standards and Disclosure Act of 2005" sets requirements for software used in electronic voting machines in federal elections. The "Improving Electronic Voting Standards and Disclosure Act of 2005" mandates specific requirements for software used in electronic voting machines for federal elections, including the manufacturer providing updated software copies and testing machines before election day. The Act mandates requirements for software used in electronic voting machines, including updated information on software writers and their criminal history. The deadline for adopting voluntary guidance by the Commission is extended to January 1, 2006. Laboratories must meet standards prohibiting conflicts of interest for accreditation of testing voting system hardware and software. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 mandates requirements for electronic voting machine software, including standards to prevent conflicts of interest in testing and certification. Laboratories seeking accreditation must meet criteria ensuring independence from financial interests in voting system hardware and software. The Election Assistance Commission must establish standards for electronic voting machine software by January 1, 2006, as mandated by the Help America Vote Act of 2002. SEC. 4. Posting notice of availability of administrative complaint procedures for voting machine failures. Section 303(b)(2) of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 is amended to include information on the availability of administrative complaint procedures for voting machine issues. Section 402(a) clarifies the standing required for filing a complaint. Clarification of standing required for filing complaint regarding voting machine or equipment issues under Help America Vote Act of 2002. An individual must be eligible to use the machine or equipment in question to file a complaint about its malfunction. The amendments made by this Act will be effective starting from the November 2006 general election for Federal office and all future Federal elections.
